alwayshappi.highlight: Shopware storefront improvements, Excel import to DB, custom footer, and N8N integration.
alwayshappi.description: An automation and content refresh targeting Excel imports that write to the database and forward clean payloads to N8N for downstream workflows. The storefront gained a customizable homepage popup and clean footer with social icons, and Shopware↔N8N connectivity was configured for reliability. Product onboarding is quicker, and repetitive tasks move off people and into automation.

ayugold.highlight: Custom after-quote logic, and forgot-password redirect fix using Magento 2.
ayugold.description: A focused enhancement to the quote offer and authentication process, dividing post-quote flows whenever carts have READY and PO items so pricing and lead times are accurate. The work also included adding filter on backstore and fix to a broken forgot-password flow that previously caused 404 redirects. Together, these fixes brings the storefront into alignment with business reality and solidifies an important recovery flow.

bbp.description: A lightweight delivery companion that pairs barcode scanning with GPS so that all parcel and courier movement is within view. Couriers scan all parcels, start trips with location enabled, and stream positions, giving admins a live map of routes and progress. The result is improved accountability across daily runs.
specifications: Basic delivery status and route visibility

biofarma.highlight: Backend GraphQL APIs for orders, billing, and customers with scoped auth, caching, and pagination—making day-to-day operations faster and safer.
biofarma.description: Implemented backend GraphQL endpoints covering orders, billing, and customer data. The APIs use token-scoped authorization (different results for authenticated and unauthenticated call). Operational actions (e.g., cancel order) are validated and logged for audibility, and the error model is also formalized so clients experience clear. Admin workflows such as available bill and billing status are surfaced with GraphQL to facilitate automation of back-office processes.

charicedecoratie.description: Developing an app to automate Charicedecoratie's entire business process—from package booking (date/time conflict check, package-type dynamic forms), payment with transfer receipt and automatic cancel when deadline exceeded, to rescheduling with rules (only valid if paid and 2+ days in advance). On the operational front, admins get reminders for events, are able to assign freelancers/PICs, perform monthly stock counts, record outbound notes, and monitor auto depreciation of assets by useful life. There's a statistics dashboard: favorite package charts, monthly/yearly income & expense views, and change history for audit purposes. Google Place integration facilitates easy entry of event locations.

hotel-at-home.highlight: Backend REST APIs for catalog, cart/checkout, orders, and admin/reporting with auth, validation, pagination, and caching—speeding up and making day-to-day activities more reliable.
hotel-at-home.description: Implemented backend that drives product discovery and checkout for Hotel At Home. The service provides authenticated endpoints for products, categories, search/filter/sort, and product detail, along with a full cart/checkout flow with hard validation and idempotency so orders can't double-submit. Order APIs (list/detail, status transitions, cancel), back-office export/report endpoints, and standardized error responses so clients fail predictably

lnj-logistic.highlight: Warehouse & logistics web app—tracks inbound/outbound, inventory, and delivery documents with role-based controls.
lnj-logistic.description: An end-to-end warehouse & logistics solution that rolls inbound receiving, outbound/shipping, inventory, and sales/purchase orders into role-based access. Responsive screens with searchable/paginated tables, inline validation, and printable documents (delivery notes, pick lists, goods receipts). Exposed REST API for orders, inventory, and reports; and normalized errors so the UI and external tools are deterministic. The upshot is faster day-to-day operation, less manual fiddling, and clearer accountability.

msglow.highlight: Flutter analytics app with dashboards, leaderboards, and geolocation.
msglow.description: A real-time sales performance cockpit combining KPI dashboards with an order status pipeline, best-seller insights, and views of profits. Users can filter trends, drill into stages from pending to received, and monitor live orders as they happen. A customer leaderboard and map at the city level rounds it out so teams can see momentum and bottlenecks in real-time.

natours.highlight: Travel/tour booking app with map-based tour views, secure auth, Stripe checkout, and user reviews.
natours.description: Implemented an MVC structure with clean controllers and reusable middleware, JWT authentication with permission based on role (user/admin), and a Stripe checkout process which makes paid bookings and adds user history. Tours feature rich detail pages with map to display locations, as well as a reviews system to enable users to rate and comment after purchase. The app uses central validation and error handling so that both API and pages fail consistently, with security middleware (rate-limit, sanitizing) and performance optimizations (lean queries, caching where appropriate) to guarantee responsiveness and production-ready experience.

nickscali.highlight: Catalog backend services (PLP/PDP), store-view/multi-store rules, READY vs PO/backorder logic, and ticketing integration—with good validation, caching, and stable error handling.
nickscali.description: Implemented category (PLP) and product-detail (PDP) pages with custom child and storeview base. Add availability models for READY vs PO/backorder products (lead times and order constraints). Also check raised ticket services

sakafarma.highlight: Backend catalog/search, checkout & orders, and admin/reporting APIs with auth, validation, caching, and pagination.
sakafarma.description: Implemented authenticated endpoints for products/categories (pagination, filtering, sorting, searching), a validated cart/checkout process with idempotent place-order, and order APIs for list/detail, status update, and cancellation. Added exports/reports for back-office, normalized error, cache targeting, and audit logs for traceability.

samsonite.highlight: Laravel-based Excel import for products & prices with detailed history logs.
samsonite.description: A staged update pipeline where product and price lists are ingested via Excel, validated and mapped, and an auditable record is left behind. Showing failures are exposed with clarity to allow data issues to be resolved in the moment and a log tracks which rows passed or failed. The result is faster updates with traceability that endures.

sinarmasapp.highlight: XML export and GraphQL additions for production date, reviews/ratings, form labels, and spec forms.
sinarmasapp.description: Implemented XML export pipeline with field mapping, pagination, and validation for downstream systems. Contributed to the GraphQL schema/resolvers to expose production date, reviews/ratings (with filter/sort/pagination and aggregates), form labels, and specification-form datasets. Added token-scoped access, consistent errors, resolver batching to avoid N+1, and selective caching on hot reads.

air-quality-meteorology.highlight: Predict PM2.5/PM10 from weather features using Linear/SVR + tree/boosting models with cross-validation and tuning.
air-quality-meteorology.description: Explored pollutant–weather correlations using heatmaps and distributions; performed preprocessing using imputation, scaling, and one-hot encoding. Trained Linear Regression, SVR, Random Forest, Gradient Boosting, and LightGBM using GridSearchCV and cross-validation. Evaluated using R²/MAE/MSE/RMSE and checked over/underfitting using train vs. validation errors comparison; visualized results in clean tables/plots.
